compounddef.title: Managing Buddies and buddy list and presence

detaileddescription.para: Does not automatically accept an incoming subscription request. This policy implies that a decision has to be taken for each incoming subscription request notified by callback SephoneCoreVTable.new_subscription_requested
Rejects incoming subscription request.
Automatically accepts a subscription request.
Enum controlling behavior for incoming subscription request. Use by sephone_friend_set_inc_subscribe_policy()
Offline
Online
Busy
Be right back
Away
On the phone
Out to lunch
Do not disturb
Moved in this sate, call can be redirected if an alternate contact address has been set using function sephone_core_set_presence_info()
Using another messaging service
Pending
Vacation

Enum describing remote friend status Deprecated
Use SephonePresenceModel and SephonePresenceActivity instead
This value means that the associated contact element, if any, is ready to accept communication.
This value means that the associated contact element, if any, is unable to accept communication.
Basic status as defined in section 4.1.4 of RFC 3863
This value is not defined in the RFC, it corresponds to no activity with a basic status of "closed".
This value is not defined in the RFC, it corresponds to no activity with a basic status of "open".

The person has a calendar appointment, without specifying exactly of what type. This activity is indicated if more detailed information is not available or the person chooses not to reveal more information.
The person is physically away from all interactive communication devices.
The person is eating the first meal of the day, usually eaten in the morning.
The person is busy, without further details.
The person is having his or her main meal of the day, eaten in the evening or at midday.
This is a scheduled national or local holiday.
The person is riding in a vehicle, such as a car, but not steering.
The person is looking for (paid) work.
The person is eating his or her midday meal.
The person is scheduled for a meal, without specifying whether it is breakfast, lunch, or dinner, or some other meal.
The person is in an assembly or gathering of people, as for a business, social, or religious purpose. A meeting is a sub-class of an appointment.
The person is talking on the telephone.
The person is engaged in an activity with no defined representation. A string describing the activity in plain text SHOULD be provided.

A performance is a sub-class of an appointment and includes musical, theatrical, and cinematic performances as well as lectures. It is distinguished from a meeting by the fact that the person may either be lecturing or be in the audience, with a potentially large number of other people, making interruptions particularly noticeable.
The person will not return for the foreseeable future, e.g., because it is no longer working for the company.
The person is occupying himself or herself in amusement, sport, or other recreation.
The person is giving a presentation, lecture, or participating in a formal round-table discussion.
The person is visiting stores in search of goods or services.
The person is sleeping.
The person is observing an event, such as a sports event.
The person is controlling a vehicle, watercraft, or plane.
The person is on a business or personal trip, but not necessarily in-transit.
The person is watching television.
The activity of the person is unknown.
A period of time devoted to pleasure, rest, or relaxation.
The person is engaged in, typically paid, labor, as part of a profession or job.
The person is participating in religious rites.
Activities as defined in section 3.2 of RFC 4480
Enum controlling behavior for incoming subscription request. Use by sephone_friend_set_inc_subscribe_policy()

Enum describing remote friend status Deprecated
Use SephonePresenceModel and SephonePresenceActivity instead
Represents a buddy, all presence actions like subscription and status change notification are performed on this object
Basic status as defined in section 4.1.4 of RFC 3863
Activities as defined in section 3.2 of RFC 4480
Presence model type holding information about the presence of a person.
Presence person holding information about a presence person.
Presence service type holding information about a presence service.
Presence activity type holding information about a presence activity.
Presence note type holding information about a presence note.

Contructor
a new empty SephoneFriend

Contructor same as sephone_friend_new() + sephone_friend_set_address()
addr
a buddy address, must be a sip uri like sip:joe@sip.linphone.org
a new SephoneFriend with address initialized

Destroy a SephoneFriend.

SephoneFriend object

Use sephone_friend_unref() instead.

SephoneFriend object

SephoneFriend object

SephoneFriend object
name

SephoneFriend object
The display name of this friend

get subscription flag value
lf
SephoneFriend object
returns true is subscription is activated for this friend

Configure SephoneFriend to subscribe to presence information
fr
SephoneFriend object
val
if TRUE this friend will receive subscription message

Configure incoming subscription policy for this friend.
fr
SephoneFriend object
pol
SephoneSubscribePolicy policy to apply.

get current subscription policy for this SephoneFriend
lf
SephoneFriend object
SephoneSubscribePolicy
Starts editing a friend configuration.

Because friend configuration must be consistent, applications MUST call sephone_friend_edit() before doing any attempts to modify friend configuration (such as address or subscription policy and so on). Once the modifications are done, then the application must call sephone_friend_done() to commit the changes.

Commits modification made to the friend configuration.
fr
SephoneFriend object

Get the status of a friend
lf
A SephoneFriend object
SephoneOnlineStatus Deprecated
Use sephone_friend_get_presence_model() instead

Get the presence model of a friend
lf
A SephoneFriend object
A SephonePresenceModel object, or NULL if the friend do not have presence information (in which case he is considered offline)
Store user pointer to friend object.
Retrieve user data associated with friend.

Set the reference key of a friend.
lf
SephoneFriend object.
key
The reference key to use for the friend.

Get the reference key of a friend.
lf
SephoneFriend object.
The reference key of the friend.

Check that the given friend is in a friend list.
lf
SephoneFriend object.
TRUE if the friend is in a friend list, FALSE otherwise.

Return humain readable presence status
ss

Use SephonePresenceModel, SephonePresenceActivity and sephone_presence_activity_to_string() instead.

SephoneCore object
The created SephoneFriend object

SephoneCore object
address
A string containing the address to create the SephoneFriend from
The created SephoneFriend object

Creates a presence model specifying an activity.
activity
The activity to set for the created presence model.
description
An additional description of the activity (mainly useful for the 'other' activity). Set it to NULL to not add a description.
The created presence model, or NULL if an error occured.
sephone_presence_model_new
sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity_and_note The created presence model has the activity specified in the parameters.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephonePresenceActivityType activity, const char *description, const char *note, const char *lang)
memberdef.name: sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity_and_note

detaileddescription.para:
Creates a presence model specifying an activity and adding a note.
activity
The activity to set for the created presence model.
description
An additional description of the activity (mainly useful for the 'other' activity). Set it to NULL to not add a description.
note
An additional note giving additional information about the contact presence.
lang
The language the note is written in. It can be set to NULL in order to not specify the language of the note.
The created presence model, or NULL if an error occured.
sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity
sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity_and_note The created presence model has the activity and the note specified in the parameters.

Gets the basic status of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the basic status from.
The SephonePresenceBasicStatus of the SephonePresenceModel object given as parameter.

Sets the basic status of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to set the basic status.
basic_status
The SephonePresenceBasicStatus to set for the SephonePresenceModel object.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Gets the timestamp of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the timestamp from.
The timestamp of the SephonePresenceModel object or -1 on error.

Gets the contact of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the contact from.
A pointer to a dynamically allocated string containing the contact, or NULL if no contact is found. The returned string is to be freed by calling ms_free().

Sets the contact of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to set the contact.
contact
The contact string to set.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Gets the first activity of a presence model (there is usually only one).
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the activity from.
A SephonePresenceActivity object if successful, NULL otherwise.

Sets the activity of a presence model (limits to only one activity).
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to set the activity.
activity
The SephonePresenceActivityType to set for the model.
description
An additional description of the activity to set for the model. Can be NULL if no additional description is to be added.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error. WARNING: This function will modify the basic status of the model according to the activity being set. If you don't want the basic status to be modified automatically, you can use the combination of sephone_presence_model_set_basic_status(), sephone_presence_model_clear_activities() and sephone_presence_model_add_activity().

Gets the number of activities included in the presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the number of activities from.
The number of activities included in the SephonePresenceModel object.

Gets the nth activity of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the activity from.
idx
The index of the activity to get (the first activity having the index 0).
A pointer to a SephonePresenceActivity object if successful, NULL otherwise.

Adds an activity to a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to add an activity.
activity
The SephonePresenceActivity object to add to the model.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Clears the activities of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to clear the activities.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Gets the first note of a presence model (there is usually only one).
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the note from.
lang
The language of the note to get. Can be NULL to get a note that has no language specified or to get the first note whatever language it is written into.
A pointer to a SephonePresenceNote object if successful, NULL otherwise.

Adds a note to a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to add a note to.
note_content
The note to be added to the presence model.
lang
The language of the note to be added. Can be NULL if no language is to be specified for the note.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error. Only one note for each language can be set, so e.g. setting a note for the 'fr' language if there is only one will replace the existing one.

Clears all the notes of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel for which to clear notes.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Creates a default presence model.
The created presence model, NULL on error.
sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity
sephone_presence_model_new_with_activity_and_note The created presence model is considered 'offline'.

Gets the number of services included in the presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the number of services from.
The number of services included in the SephonePresenceModel object.

Gets the nth service of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the service from.
idx
The index of the service to get (the first service having the index 0).
A pointer to a SephonePresenceService object if successful, NULL otherwise.

Adds a service to a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to add a service.
service
The SephonePresenceService object to add to the model.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Clears the services of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to clear the services.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Gets the number of persons included in the presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the number of persons from.
The number of persons included in the SephonePresenceModel object.

Gets the nth person of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object to get the person from.
idx
The index of the person to get (the first person having the index 0).
A pointer to a SephonePresencePerson object if successful, NULL otherwise.

Adds a person to a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to add a person.
person
The SephonePresencePerson object to add to the model.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Clears the persons of a presence model.
model
The SephonePresenceModel object for which to clear the persons.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

Creates a presence service.
id
The id of the presence service to be created. Can be NULL to generate it automatically.
basic_status
The SephonePresenceBasicStatus to set for the SephonePresenceService object.
contact
The contact string to set.
The created presence service, NULL on error. The created presence service has the basic status 'closed'.

Gets the id of a presence service.
service
The SephonePresenceService object to get the id from.
A pointer to a dynamically allocated string containing the id, or NULL in case of error. The returned string is to be freed by calling ms_free().

service
The SephonePresenceService object for which to set the id.
id
The id string to set. Can be NULL to generate it automatically.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

The SephonePresenceBasicStatus to set for the SephonePresenceService object.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

A pointer to a dynamically allocated string containing the contact, or NULL if no contact is found. The returned string is to be freed by calling ms_free().

The SephonePresenceService object for which to set the contact.
contact
The contact string to set.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

The number of notes included in the SephonePresenceService object.

A pointer to a SephonePresenceNote object if successful, NULL otherwise.

service

The SephonePresenceNote object to add to the service.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

service
The SephonePresenceService object for which to clear the notes.
0 if successful, a value < 0 in case of error.

detaileddescription.para:
Create a SephonePresenceModel with the given activity type, activity description, note content and note language.

SephoneCore object.

The SephonePresenceActivityType to set for the activity of the created model.
description
An additional description of the activity to set for the activity. Can be NULL if no additional description is to be added.
note
The content of the note to be added to the created model.
lang
The language of the note to be added to the created model.
The created SephonePresenceModel object.

detaileddescription.para:
Create a SephonePresenceService with the given id, basic status and contact.
lc
SephoneCore object.
id
The id of the service to be created.
basic_status
The basic status of the service to be created.
contact
A string containing a contact information corresponding to the service to be created.
The created SephonePresenceService object.

Contructor same as sephone_friend_new() + sephone_friend_set_address() Deprecated
Use sephone_friend_new_with_address instead

Set SephoneAddress for this friend Deprecated
Use sephone_friend_set_address instead

Buddies and buddy list Each buddy is represented by a #LinphoneFriend object created by function linphone_friend_new(). Buddy configuration parameters like sip uri or status publication policy for this friend are configurable for each buddy. Here under a typical buddy creation: LinphoneFriend*my_friend=linphone_friend_new_with_addr("sip:joe@sip.linphone.org");/*createsfriendobjectforbuddyjoe*/ linphone_friend_enable_subscribes(my_friend,TRUE);/*configurethisfriendtoemitSUBSCRIBEmessageafterbeingaddedtoLinphoneCore*/ linphone_friend_set_inc_subscribe_policy(my_friend,LinphoneSPAccept);/*acceptIncomingsubscriptionrequestforthisfriend*/ friends status changes are reported by callback LinphoneCoreVTable.notify_presence_recv staticvoidnotify_presence_recv_updated(struct_LinphoneCore*lc,LinphoneFriend*friend){ constLinphoneAddress*friend_address=linphone_friend_get_address(friend); printf("Newstatestate[%s]foruserid[%s]\n" ,linphone_online_status_to_string(linphone_friend_get_status(friend)) ,linphone_address_as_string(friend_address)); }
Once created a buddy can be added to the buddy list using function linphone_core_add_friend() . Added friends will be notified about local status changes Any subsequente modifications to #LinphoneFriend must be first started by a call to function linphone_friend_edit() and validated by function linphone_friend_done() linphone_friend_edit(my_friend);/*starteditingfriend*/ linphone_friend_enable_subscribes(my_friend,FALSE);/*disablesubscriptionforthisfriend*/ linphone_friend_done(my_friend);/*commitchangestriggeringanUNSUBSCRIBEmessage*/
Publishing presence status Local presence status can be changed using function linphone_core_set_presence_model() .New status is propagated to all friends previously added to #LinphoneCore.

Handling incoming subscription request New incoming subscription requests are process according to the incoming subscription policy state for subscription initiated by members of the buddy list. For incoming request comming from an unknown buddy, the call back LinphoneCoreVTable.new_subscription_request is invoked.
A complete tutorial can be found at : Registration tutorial
